data.title: Nobel Lecture Series: Elias Canetti
data.meta_description: Elias Canetti was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1981. He was a Bulgarian modernist novelist, playwright, memoirist, and non-fiction writer. He is known for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas, and artistic power. Presented by Davide Stimilli, Professor of German, powered by Localist Event Calendar Software
data.text: Elias Canetti was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1981. He was a Bulgarian modernist novelist, playwright, memoirist, and non-fiction writer. He is known for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas, and artistic power. Presented by Davide Stimilli, Professor of German
